fields.tip: In my experience, if you wake up with the headache, chances are you were grinding your teeth at night or clenching your jaw. Try massaging your jaw and temples and see if the headache doesn't subside. Or seek out a professional massage. Also look at the stresses in your life and see if maybe some relaxation might be called for.
fields.title: Not tonight honey. Headache?

fields.tip: Often GERD is not caused by too much stomach acid, but actually too little, called hypochlorhydria. So what you're actually burping up is not stomach acid, but food that hasn't been digested fully and released into the small intestines. Short term, acid reducers may help, but what we should actually be doing is INCREASING the acid. You can do that with acid supplementation, but often taking apple cider vinegar with meals will help the problem go away. Try it and good luck!
fields.title: Experiencing Acid Reflux or GERD?

fields.tip:
Stay up to date with my weekly video health tips. These range in length from 90 seconds to 2 1/2 minutes. Something you want to learn about? Let me know and I'll do a video for it. 
http://www.youtube.com/drkathygruver
fields.title: Weekly video health tips

fields.tip: Many women are concerned about bone health. If you're a soda drinker you may have even more to be worried about. Soda is high in phosporus which leeches calcium from the bones. This is especially bad for young girls when the bone is growing, strengthening and setting up the future of its health. So please, eliminate soda for better bone health.
fields.title: Stave off osteoporosis

fields.tip:
All of our lives have been touched by cancer. Read my latest article to find out how to prevent it and what to do if you've been diagnosed.

http://qualityoflifemagazine.com/Cancer.html
fields.title: Affected by cancer?

fields.tip: Sciatica is a common condition. Sometimes it's simply caused by a tight piriformis, the muscle that runs through the gluteal region. Often massage on this area can loosen the muscle and take the pressure off the sciatic nerve. Give it a try.
fields.title: Pain in the butt?

fields.tip: We are calcium happy in this society. And I'm not saying we don't need it. But I think magnesium is more important and keep a giant bottle of it in the house. It's helpful for muscle spasms, headaches, menstrual and muscle cramps, mood, sleep and PMS? And we need it for the calcium to be absorbed. Who can ask for anything more?
fields.title: Calcium, smalcium, where's my magnesium?

fields.tip:
We are a society that relies heavily on prescription drugs and they can be very beneficial in many circumstances. But they can also cause myriad side effects. These new illnesses caused by the treatment of the first illness is known as iatrogenic disease. 
Examine the prescriptions that you take and know what side effects might be caused by them. And if a new condition develops as a result of taking a prescription, make sure you tell your doctor. I would never advise anyone to stop taking a prescription, but I do advise you to know your body and talk to your physician if either the drug is not effective or if it's causing further problems.
fields.title: But it was supposed to help...

fields.tip: The last radio interview I did talked about the benefits of massage, but what we ended up speaking about was being clear in your communication with the therapist. They should always listen to your instruction, especially regarding pressure. If something is uncomfortable or doesn't feel right to you, please, please, please, tell your therapist!!!!
fields.title: Speak your mind

fields.tip: The seasons are about to change and the weather, in most parts of the country is about to turn cold. It's a time that the sinuses might need some extra help. Try washing out your nasal passages with a neti pot. The neti pot looks like a miniature teapot and uses saline solution to clean and soothe and the nose. Acupuncture is a great modality for preparing for the change of seasons. Go now, to start preparing for fall and winter weather changes. And have a healthy day!
fields.title: Breath Free

fields.tip: I find that when my body is feeling achy, often times it's just trying to get rid of toxins. Use a dry brush before your shower (brush the limbs towards the heart) and feel like a kitten. Use a natural salt or sugar scrub in the shower to top off the cleansing experience. Luxurious AND healthy!
fields.title: Feel like a cat

fields.tip: If you found that you overindulged in either food or drink, try taking the homeopathic Nux Vomica. I found it great for that over-do-it feeling. Take it before you go to bed and wake up feeling not quite so bad. Don't forget plenty of water!
fields.title: Had a bit too much?

fields.tip: I usually recommend that my clients cut out dairy, specifically milk. It is loaded full of hormones and antibiotics and is not as nutritious after being processed. If you need calcium and other minerals they can be gotten through increased consumption of veggies like spinach. I see many children suffering from chronic ear infections. Try taking them off cow's milk to see if it clears up.
fields.title: Got milk? Think again.

fields.tip: I see many men in my office complaing of low back and hip pain. Make sure you're not sitting on your wallet. It can throw your whole body out of balance. Keep in your briefcase, desk drawer or in your front pocket.
fields.title: Men. Low back pain?

fields.tip: Having trouble catching those zzz's? Try taking L-Tryptophan an essential amino acid that we don't always get enough of in our food. Always follow the instructions on the label and don't take if you are on SSRI's for depression. Sweet dreams!
fields.title: Trouble Sleeping?

fields.description: Join me and a panel of other speakers including Michael Cervin (www.cervinitstraight.com) as we talk about water and water issues. My lecture is entitled A History of Healing; Water through the Ages. Should be fascinating!
fields.title: Berkeley Springs International Water Competition

fields.description: We are what we eat. But we also are what we think. Did you know that you can change your physiology by changing your thoughts and words? Join Dr. Kathy Gruver, author of The Alternative Medicine Cabinet, as she teaches you practical ways to improve your health and change your body by changing your mind. Also discover what your pain might be telling you about your hidden emotions. A fun informative workshop to have better health and slower aging.
fields.title: Change your Mind to Change your Body

fields.description: The post-holiday period is a time for renewed focus. We are at peak performance as communicators when we feel physically, mentally and emotionally fit. We tend to lose focus when we feel overwhelmed, lack energy, lose sleep or have physical complaints. Our expert panel will discuss steps each of us can take to improve our effectiveness. With their guidance, learn how to improve productivity, reduce stress, achieve better work-life balance and enhance joie de vivre.
fields.title: Healthy Self for Healthy Communication

fields.description: Join me as I explain the ins and outs of healthy eating. Navigating the waters of nutrition can be confusing. Are eggs, wheat and soy really good for us? And what does MSG, HFCS and GMOs have to do with me? You'll find out this Saturday at Whole Foods Market in Santa Barbara. Join me for free.
fields.title: Navigating Nutrition

fields.description: Join me as a panelist talking about how to stay healthy while traveling. I'll discuss food poisoning, vitamins and minerals, food combining, homeopathics and the healthiest way to survive the buffet. I'll also talk about Genetically Modified Foods and why organic is usually best. Look forward to seeing you there.
fields.title: Travel for Foodies: Tips, Trends and Tools for the Culinary Traveler at the Los Angeles Travel and Adventure Show

fields.description: Join myself and other expert speakers as we help sufferers of RA navigate through life. The 2nd annual symposium offers workshops, speakers and exhibits. Learn about medical treatments, research updates, transitions from school to a career and lots more!
fields.title: Arthritis in PrimeTime

fields.description: Join me in the Author's Corner on Lifetime Television's The Balancing Act, 7AM nationwide on March 1. I will be speaking with host Danielle Knox and talking about natural health alternatives and my book, The Alternative Medicine Cabinet.
fields.title: The Balancing Act

fields.description: During a recent stay at the Hyatt Regency Hotel in Monterey, CA I had an amazing spa experience. Victoria Icaza, the lead massage therapist gave me an incredible deep tissue massage. Her communication was fabulous, depth was excellent and the treatment room was gorgeous. They use these incredible massage table that are not only comfortable and heated but functional as they bend and move to support the body. It even sits you up after the massage. Excellent experience...and you know how picky I am!
fields.title: Need a fabulous spa experience in Monterey?

fields.description: A great collection of natural remedy products that everyone can use in their cabinet. Enjoy and share!
fields.title: Natural Remedies Article

fields.description: Need information about what is contained in vaccines and current studies on their safety? Check out this informative site. And take the time to be informed.
fields.title: Need info about vaccines

fields.description:
Anyone finding themselves with this scary disease needs to have access to good resources. This site provides information, references, treatment options, help for veterans, even legal referrals. Don't feel lost and like you are dealing with this illness alone. Check out this site and take charge of your health! They are here to help!

From their site: 

Mesothelioma Resource Online has created and developed this site to provide answers and support for people diagnosed with mesothelioma cancer, as well as their families and loved ones. Mesothelioma is a rare form of cancer that is caused by exposure to asbestos and has long been considered a mystery and incurable. However, over the past two decades, physicians, scientists and researchers have begun to unravel this mystery and help people diagnose mesothelioma in its earlier stages, while providing more extensive forms of treatment, vast resources, and general information to make coping and survival more about optimism rather than uncertainty.
fields.title: Mesothelioma Cancer Resource

fields.description:
Check out this link for resources on cancer, prevention, diet, nutrition and supporting practitioners. More info is available at http://cancerfree123.com/book/

Learn about Julie's amazing journey through cancer and how she gathered resources to help others. You don't have to do this alone!
fields.title: Fabulous Cancer Resource

fields.description:
Head to this site to follow on Facebook and Twitter and find out how you can help get this important initiative on the ballot next November. Protect ourselves and our children by getting us out of the largest experiment on the planet. GMOs have never been proven safe and we don't know what they are doing to our bodies. Help us get them labeled. Go to www.labelgmos.org 

And thanks for helping!
fields.title: Help us get GMOs labeled in CA

fields.description:
I've been doing massage for 20 years and in that time I've met a lot of chiropractors. I find massage and chiropractic to be the perfect combination for health. I can highly recommend Dr. Jim Cochran and his associates at Advanced Chiropractic Group. They have gotten me out of many structural jams and have been kind and effective for my clients. Check out their new website and tell them that Kathy sent you! 

James A. Cochran, DC
www.advancedchiropracticgroup.com
805.681.7322
fields.title: Phenomenal Chiropractic in Santa Barbara

fields.description: This network only airs positive mind/body/spirit programming. With their new online format, you can see excellent lectures and TV 24/7. Enjoy!
fields.title: Oasis TV for great programming

fields.description: Dr. Cathy Rosenbaum is a holistic clinical pharmacist and Founder & CEO of Rx Integrative Solutions, a personalized consulting practice in holistic medicine.  She believes that prescription medications are running our lives and there is a more sustainable path to healing through lifestyle changes and non-traditional medicine.  Dr. Cathy has traveled to China to study herbal and prescription medicine research and global healthcare solutions, working in partnership with traditional medicine physicians.  She is an internationally recognized speaker, author, holistic consultant, and radio show host (Your Holistic Health WMKV 89.3 FM Mondays @ 5:30 pm ET Cincinnati www.wmkvfm.org). And I was privileged to be a featured guest on Dr. Cathy's show, archived on itunes.
fields.title: How a Holistic Pharmacy can help you.

fields.description: Do you have 90 seconds a week to learn about your health? Tune in for short and informative weekly updates about how you can take better control of your and your family's health and wellness. Please subscribe and they will just arrive to you weekly.
fields.title: Weekly video health tips

fields.description: These journals are a great way to track your health to not only see your progress, but also observe patterns of how you feel. Not just a blank book journal, these have sections for what you eat, how your body feels, what supplements you take and what the weather is like. I love mine, it's been a big help for charting my health. Pick one up, you can order directly from their website.
fields.title: Keep track of your health

fields.description: This is a great resource for anyone visiting Santa Barbara and the surrounding areas or frankly, anyone that lives here too! Wonderful, inspiring ideas for what to do up and down the coast. Subscribe and don't miss a thing!
fields.title: Santa Barbara and the Central Coast resource

fields.description: I used this company to send out a press release and it was great. Easy to use and effective. Need to get info out? This was a great resource!
fields.title: Need to get info out?

fields.description: A very informative and entertaining site sponsored by twin sisters, Kimberley and Alexandra. Email in a question and participate in the fun.
fields.site: Fun and Fit, Q and A with K and A
fields.title: Fun and Fit in 2010

fields.description: I was introduced to this product through a fellow Linked-In member. It looks facinating and promising. Watch this short video for more information. As a note, I am not affiliated with this company in any way and get no renumeration for promoting this product. I just think it might help people suffering from the effects of chemo.
fields.title: Help with chemotherapy

fields.description: For a healthy raw snack, check out Alyssa Boyle's Cavewoman Bars. These are tasty, affordable and good for you. I keep them in my car and in my drawer at the office in case I need a quick snack. Check them out and tell her that Kathy sent you!
fields.title: Need a healthy snack?

fields.description: A great source for high quality homeopathics. I've used their products for years and recommend them highly! Custom remedies available. Check it out!
fields.title: Homeopathic Care

fields.description: Learn about how you can take action to help keep our food supply safe and truthfully labeled. Sign up to receive updates about legislation and what is happening with additives and GMOs. Donate if you want to help support this fabulous organization, I do.
fields.title: Safe Food Now

fields.description: Fabulous, natural and amazing spices and teas. The owner is a gem and her products are incredible! Try them out and stop in to see her in Paso Robles. All natural, no preservatives, no MSG! Yes!
fields.title: Spice up your life

fields.description: The most amazing natural bath salts and scrubs I've ever used. The bath is my sanctuary and these products made it heaven. All natural and additive free. She also carries Shea Butter, lotions and room sprays. Check them out and you'll be clean and enlivened!
fields.title: Take the Waters

fields.description: Dr. Robert Puff and his co-host Elizabeth Lozano are doing a great job at bringing health and wellness education to the public. Their show The Holistic Success Show is well-made and informative. Dr. Puff's opening monologues are insightful and thought-provoking. And their guests are well-spoken and highly qualified. Check them out!
fields.title: Health TV online

fields.description: A fun and informative interview about natural health. Join me for an hour as I talk with father and son team Lou and Louis about everything health related. Some great discussions ensue!
fields.title: Special guest with Lou and Louis

fields.description: A great article about using dance for fitness. I speak about hiphop and how it's helped me health and my stress level. I'm even featured in the photo.
fields.title: Dance for Fitness

fields.description: Learn why I  should be your next radio guest. Info about my topics, background and credentials. Please let me know if I can help. I love educating and entertaining!
fields.title: Need a radio guest expert?

fields.description: Join me when I talk with Coach Steve about alternative therapies and how the can benefit you and your family. A fun radio interview with a great host!
fields.title: Learn about Alternative Medicine - radio show

fields.description: Join me as Tony and I talk natural health and alternative medicine. Fun, light-hearted and informative.
fields.title: Tough Talk with Tony Gambone

fields.description: Kathy and I chat about how to avoid cold and flu season, Andrew Weil and the changes occurring all around the globe. Informative, potentially controversial, and loaded with great content on health and empowerment!
fields.title: Thin, Happy, Healthy Radio interview with Alicia Cramer

fields.description: Article in the Santa Barbara Independent about my decade anniversary of healing work in the community.
fields.title: Celebrate a Decade of Healing

fields.description: Check out my latest interview on The Total Education Network. It's a good one, not to be missed where I talk about prescriptions, cancer and incorporating natural medicine into your life. Would love your feedback!
fields.title: Interview on Total Education Network

fields.description: Join me, Kathy Gruver as I join Lillian Brummet on her fabulous radio show. A great buffet of natural health info for you!
fields.title: Conscious Discussions Talk Radio

fields.description: Tune in when I talk with Alicia Cramer in a wonderful podcast. We discuss so many aspects of natural health and wellness and our philosophies on healing. Truly one of my favorite interviews. You can read her blog through the same link. Please head over there and support this great gal and learn more about your health!
fields.title: Interview on Thin Happy Healthy

fields.description: Stay up to date with my weekly video health tips. A variety of topics in a short fun video format.
fields.title: Video Health Tips

fields.description: Learn about stress and the mind/body connection in my article for Sprout Savvy, a fabulous on line magazine.
fields.title: Mind/Body Medicine

fields.description: All of our lives have been touched by cancer. Read my article to find out how to prevent it and what to do if you've been diagnosed with it.
fields.title: Cancer

fields.description: A quick interview about my book, The Alternative Medicine Cabinet and why I wrote it.
fields.title: Blog interview about my book

fields.description: Join Kathy and hosts Kymberly and Alexandra as we discuss mind/body medicine and some of the research from Kathy's Doctoral Dissertation. A great show not to be missed. Enjoy!
fields.title: Kathy on Fun and Fit Radio

fields.description: A fascinating interview on natural health with myself and Dr. Rose, the Complete Teacher. Tune in and enjoy!
fields.title: Interview with Dr. Rose

fields.description: Learn more about what I do and my new book, The Alternative Medicine Cabinet during an interview with Commitment Now.
fields.title: Interview with Commitment Now

fields.description: Head to page 58 to read my national article in Massage and Bodyworks magazine, on my experience with an IRS audit. This article is not written by an accountant or tax professional, but is my personal journey as a massage therapist to surviving an audit. I hope you never face that scary occurrence, but if you do, I hope this helps!
fields.title: Getting audited? Read my latest.

fields.description: Read my latest article on BigBlend magazine and listen in as I talk with Lisa and Nancy about the benefits of my favorite activity, massage.
fields.title: Besides feeling good, what are the benefits of massage?

fields.description: I was priviledged to have this except adapted from my book for use in BodySense Magazine, a division of Massage and Bodyworks. Enjoy!
fields.title: Excerpt from The Alternative Medicine Cabinet

fields.description:
This is what Dr. Nancy had to say about our recent radio interview and my book: 

Kathy Gruver's new book, The Alternative Medicine Cabinet, is a wonderful addition to my health and wellness library. I recommend this easy-to-follow reference to everyone as a daily guide to maintain their own health naturally. I am honored to welcome her to the community of smart amazing women who have been our guests on WomenSpeak. Thank you Kathy for your good work. 

~Dr. Nancy D. O’Reilly, Clinical Psychologist, 
Psy.DFounder of WomenSpeak.com
fields.title: Words from Dr. Nancy

fields.description: Listen in on my interview with Dr. Nancy as we discuss ways that women can be healthier. It's a great time to start on a path to better health. How can I help?
fields.title: Learn health tips for busy women

fields.description: Read my latest article and listen in on my radio interview about Fibromyalgia.
fields.title: All about Fibromyalgia

fields.description: This is the master page from Big Blend Magazine where I am a featured writer and radio guest. At the bottom of the page there are links to my past interviews and articles. Please check them out and feel free to email me with any questions or requests. Thanks for looking!
fields.title: A bevy of information about natural health

fields.description: Read Kathy's latest article on cleansing the body and why it's beneficial. At the bottom of the page is a link to her radio interview covering the same topic. Thanks for looking and have a healthy day!
fields.title: Cleansing the Body

fields.description: Kathy's book, The Alternative Medicine Cabinet was selected as a finalist for the IndyExcellence Awards. She is honored for the recognition!

fields.source: Danielle Knox, host of Lifetime Television's The Balancing Act
fields.description: I've found The Alternative Medicine Cabinet to be incredibly helpful in my own journey towards more natural remedies and healing. I think readers will feel the same way. When Kathy was on our show, she delivered information in an informative, detailed and straightforward manner that was easy to understand.  Go Kathy! Well done!

Read my most recent book review
 http://blog.4healthinc.com/wp/?p=352

Read my most recent DVD review: 
http://blog.4healthinc.com/wp/?p=386

fields.source: Dr. Nancy D. O’Reilly, Clinical Psychologist, Psy.D, Founder of www.WomenSpeak.com
fields.description: Kathy Gruver's new book, The Alternative Medicine Cabinet, is a wonderful addition to my health and wellness library. I recommend this easy-to-follow reference to everyone as a daily guide to maintain their own health naturally. I am honored to welcome her to the community of smart amazing women who have been our guests on WomenSpeak. Thank you Kathy for your good work.

I found the book to be inspiring and one thing I really enjoyed was the positive attitude” message. Dr. Gruver makes it abundantly clear that our minds have a lot of power in our lives. As the saying goes, “you are what you eat,” we are reminded in this book that we are what we think too.

The author has a sensible writing style, easy to read, understand and easy to follow ideas and solutions, most of which I would say are preventative measures. When I sat down to look at this book I was taken in right away and ended up reading the whole thing in one sitting.

This is a great book and guide for someone who wants to learn how to take charge of their own health in a natural way, ways to boost our immunity and how to empower ourselves to be an active participant in our own medical/health lives. I thoroughly enjoyed the book and I will surely be referring to it again and again.
This book was really good...It's a great book to give to your Western doctor to enlighten them about other remedies for cancer, high blood pressure, or indigestion.

If you’re just learning about Alternative Medicine or are seeking a quickie review of the subject, Gruver’s book will give you enough to swallow and digest. It’s a worthwhile guide for those interested in navigating the complex waters of alternative medicine.
Not only does Gruver’s book introduce you to a wide range of alternative remedies, it also delves into health tips you can practice, to achieve improved health.

This book is a straight to the point resource for all considering small lifestyle changes for better health. I found it most helpful that it wasn't written in hard-to-pronounce words and was applicable for even the most novice of alternative patients.

fields.source: Men and Health: It's a guy thing (blog by Scott Keith)
fields.description: Gruver's compact guide to Alternative Medicine is great for people "on the fence" or not quite sure whether to embrace the idea. It's a chance to open your eyes to remedies that, in some cases, rely on ingredients direct from earth.

If you are looking for a way to handle your health in a natural way, then the book, The Alternative Medicine Cabinet is a must read. This book is a true resource to any health circumstances you might be encountering and breaks down alternative medicine. Kathy is very knowledgeable of natural and holistic living.

I liked that so many of her suggestions were easy to incorporate and implement; making
it easy for young and old! She presents so many aspects of achieving good health that
I applaud her ability to explain it and organize it so easily. As a professional I learned
more about natural ways to help patients. This book continues to provide resources and
education for those who want to help themselves. Her message on how to change is
inspiring.

I love her little book. Basically Gruver covers all the important aspects. Gruver’s
knowledge and expertise shines through by giving the skeptic food for thought (pun
intended)

I do feel this would be the perfect book to have on hand or give as a gift to those
unfamiliar with the holistic field of natural medicine. The information is invaluable
to anyone. It serves as a good reminder even to the current holistic professional
to make sure they also take care of themselves, as well as those in their care.

Gruver has packed an enormous amount of information, including massage, herbs,
homeopathy and lifestyle tips and information, into a small, easily referenced book
that should not only be at every bedside/bathroom table, but in every kitchen as well.

The Alternative Medicine Cabinet is a read well worth considering for those who
embrace new age and alternative medicines.

The Alternative Medicine Cabinet is an easy read, but packed with information that everyone should know. This book is well written, covers a lot of information without being boring and is very easy to navigate. If you are interested in natural health to treat your ailments and illnesses, this book would be great for you.

fields.source: Cathy Feldman,  Program Co-Chair,  National Association of Women Business Owners, Santa Barbara
fields.description: Kathy Gruver's informative and fun workshop on Wellness and the Working Woman for NAWBO-SB was terrific.  Full of great advice on nutrition, balancing our lives as well as some easy exercises we can do throughout the day to keep us limber and well, it was a worthwhile and thoroughly professional presentation.  Thank you, Kathy.

fields.source: Beverly Mineo, National Sales Manager Canary Hotel, Santa Barbara, CA
fields.description: Recently I had the pleasure of hearing Kathy speak on the body and mind connection in achieving and maintaining good health. I found the presentation to be fascinating, educational and especially inspiring. She has a rare talent of including humor in motivating and inspiring your audience. I am involved with several groups that book speakers for seminars and other events and will be recommending Kathy to them. Thank you for such a powerful presentation, I immediately began replacing negative thoughts with positive ones!

fields.source: Danielle Knox, Host of Lifetime Television's The Balancing Act
fields.description: When Kathy was on our show, she delivered information in an informative, detailed and straightforward manner that was easy to understand.  Go Kathy! Well done!

fields.source: Elizabeth Lozano, M.A., LMFT- The Holistic Success Show
fields.description: Kathy Gruver is an intelligent, well spoken and passionate woman who knows what she's talking about!  It was such an honor to have her as a guest on our show. She was comfortable on camera, conversational, knowledgeable, and confident.  She really helped us teach our viewers some important things they need to know that can help them tremendously.  If you are looking for a great speaker, on camera or off- I highly recommend Kathy Gruver- you won't be disappointed!

fields.source: Steven Brynoff, ND, President Mediral Homeopathics
fields.description: I was privileged to sit in on Dr. Gruver’s lecture at the 2010 ANMA Annual Convention, ‘How our words affect our health.’  Her casual, confident speaking style combined with her signature sense of humor made for an informative and enjoyable presentation.  Very knowledgeable.  Examples from her practice were particularly helpful, and suggestions were effective and quick to implement.  Easily one of the finest speakers on the natural health circuit, someone to watch with eager anticipation.

Kathy approaches her lectures with the ability to relate very well to her audience. Not only is she extremely knowledgeable about health issues, she has a great sense of humor which puts the audience at ease, and therefore more willing to hear and process her valuable information.

fields.source: Lili Schafer, Program Chair, Santa Barbara Yacht Club
fields.description: Factual, informative and wildly entertaining; Thought-provoking, yet simple; charaismatic Kathy Gruver is on a roll with a unique approach to current trends in Mind-Body Medicine. A speaker you must experience!!

fields.source: Lesa Caputo, Brown and Brown Insurance
fields.description: Thanks so much for the inspiring, educational and deeply thought provoking presentation you made this morning on Women’s Health in the Workplace.  As a constantly emotionally and physically depleted working mom with a very successful and highly stressful business that I juggle with the care giving of 3 small children under the age of 6 at home, there was so much that I took away from this morning that I literally cannot wait to get started!  I am motivated, I am committed and I have you to thank for the profound reminder of the vows I need to make to myself above all others that make their demands on me daily. Bless you.

fields.source: Stuart S. Light, M.A., M.Ed., Adjunct Professor of Psychology, Antioch University, Santa Barbara
fields.description: Recently, the Global Perspectives on Stress class I teach at Antioch University in Santa Barbara had the pleasure of spending an incredibly enlightening, and inspiring afternoon with Dr. Kathy Gruver.  Not only is Dr. Gruver a spirited and engaging speaker, but her vast knowledge of nutrition, natural remedies and holistic healthcare provided the students with valuable information and knowledge that isn't available in textbooks and standard college curricula.  Dr. Gruver has the rare ability to weave animated  anecdotes from her own life history and current practice, solid scientific research, and all with a large helping of humor.  Hers is a presentation not to be missed!

fields.source: Dawn Hampton , President,  National Association of Women Business Owners, Santa Barbara
fields.description: Kathy Gruver has spoken to the National Association of Women Business Owner’s, Santa Barbara Chapter on Wellness for the Working Woman: How to Take Back Your Health and Slow Down the Aging Process. She entertains and educates and is a phenomenal speaker providing her audience with many ah-ha moments about their life and health.

fields.text:
Kathy’s consultations are a combination of healing derived from 20 years of natural health experience using a blend of:

  • Mind/Body Medicine
  • Energy Medicine like Reiki
  • Medical Massage
  • Health and life Coaching
  • Intuitive Healing
  • Creative Visualization and self-hypnosis
  • Referral to other qualified practitioners like chiropractors, acupuncturist and counselors

What I can help with:

  • Pain
  • Injuries
  • Preparation for surgery
  • Recovery after surgery
  • Life transitions
  • Healthy pregnancy
  • Emotional blocks
  • Life stresses

These consultations are available at Dr. Gruver’s office in Santa Barbara, CA, and non-massage consultations are also available over the phone and via Skype.

If you are ready to take control of your life and your health, contact Kathy now and make your appointment.
